Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Mental Health
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A state of mental well-being that enables people to cope with the stresses of life, realize their abilities, learn well and work well, and contribute to their community.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Diabetes
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A chronic health condition that affects how your body turns food into energy.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Behavioral Health
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: The connection between behaviors and the health and well-being of the body, mind and spirit.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Cancer
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A disease in which some of the body's cells grow uncontrollably and spread to other parts of the body.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Depression
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A common and serious medical illness that negatively affects how you feel, the way you think and how you act.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Dementia
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A general term for loss of memory, language, problem-solving and other thinking abilities that are severe enough to interfere with daily life.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Hypertension
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Autism
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A developmental disorder of variable severity that is characterized by difficulty in social interaction and communication and by restricted or repetitive patterns of thought and behavior.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: COPD
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, a chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Heart Failure
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A chronic condition in which the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Oral Health
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A state of being free from chronic mouth and facial pain, oral and throat cancer, oral infection and sores, periodontal (gum) disease, tooth decay, tooth loss, and other diseases and disorders that limit an individual's capacity in biting, chewing, smiling, speaking, and psychosocial wellbeing.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Cardiovascular Disease
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A class of diseases that involve the heart or blood vessels.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Neurology
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: The branch of medicine concerned with the study and treatment of disorders of the nervous system.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Sepsis
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A life-threatening medical emergency that happens when an existing infection triggers a chain reaction throughout your body.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Substance Use Disorder
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A disease that affects a person's brain and behavior and leads to an inability to control the use of a legal or illegal drug or medicine.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Cerebral Palsy
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A group of disorders that affect a person's ability to move and maintain balance and posture.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Heart Disease
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A range of conditions that affect the heart.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Penicillin Allergy
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: An abnormal reaction of your immune system to the antibiotic drug penicillin.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Spinal Fusion
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A surgical procedure used to correct problems with the small bones of the spine.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Atrial Fibrillation
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: An irregular and often very rapid heart rhythm that can lead to blood clots in the heart.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Chronic Kidney Disease
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A condition characterized by a gradual loss of kidney function over time.

Clinical Conditions & Specialties.label: Opioid Use Disorder
Clinical Conditions & Specialties.definition: A problematic pattern of opioid use that leads to clinically significant impairment or distress.

Data & Technical Standards.label: FHIR
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, a standard for exchanging healthcare information electronically.

Data & Technical Standards.label: APIs
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Application Programming Interfaces, which are software intermediaries that allow two applications to talk to each other.

Data & Technical Standards.label: USCDI
Data & Technical Standards.definition: The United States Core Data for Interoperability, a standardized set of health data classes and constituent data elements for nationwide, interoperable health information exchange.
terms: United States Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI)

Data & Technical Standards.label: HL7
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Health Level Seven International, a not-for-profit, ANSI-accredited standards developing organization dedicated to providing a comprehensive framework and related standards for the exchange, integration, sharing, and retrieval of electronic health information.

Data & Technical Standards.label: Bulk FHIR
Data & Technical Standards.definition: A FHIR specification for exporting large amounts of data from a FHIR server.

Data & Technical Standards.label: SMART on FHIR
Data & Technical Standards.definition: A set of open specifications to integrate apps with electronic health records, portals, and other health IT systems.

Data & Technical Standards.label: OpenID Connect
Data & Technical Standards.definition: An authentication protocol that is an extension of OAuth 2.0.

Data & Technical Standards.label: C-CDA
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Consolidated Clinical Document Architecture, an XML-based markup standard for creating electronic clinical documents.

Data & Technical Standards.label: CDS Hooks
Data & Technical Standards.definition: A specification from HL7 for invoking external clinical decision support services from within a clinical workflow.

Data & Technical Standards.label: SNOMED CT
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine – Clinical Terms, a globally recognized, comprehensive, and scientifically validated healthcare terminology.

Data & Technical Standards.label: DICOM
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine, the international standard for medical images and related information.
terms: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM)

Data & Technical Standards.label: LOINC
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes, a database and universal standard for identifying medical laboratory observations.

Data & Technical Standards.label: REST
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Representational State Transfer, a software architectural style for creating web services.

Data & Technical Standards.label: IPS
Data & Technical Standards.definition: See International Patient Summary.

Data & Technical Standards.label: IHE Profiles
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Integrating the Healthcare Enterprise profiles, which provide a common framework for passing information between computer systems in healthcare.

Data & Technical Standards.label: Direct Messaging
Data & Technical Standards.definition: A standard for securely exchanging health information between health care entities.

Data & Technical Standards.label: ECL
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Expression Constraint Language, a formal language for defining sets of SNOMED CT concepts.

Data & Technical Standards.label: SNODENT
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Systematized Nomenclature of Dentistry, an official subset of SNOMED CT for dentistry.

Data & Technical Standards.label: UDAP
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Unified Data Access Profiles, a security standard for scalable registration, authentication, and authorization in healthcare.

Data & Technical Standards.label: openEHR
Data & Technical Standards.definition: An open standard specification in health informatics that describes the management and storage, retrieval and exchange of health data in electronic health records.

Data & Technical Standards.label: GA4GH
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Global Alliance for Genomics and Health, an international, nonprofit alliance formed to accelerate the potential of research and medicine to advance human health.
terms: Global Alliance for Genomics and Health (GA4GH)

Data & Technical Standards.label: ICNP
Data & Technical Standards.definition: The International Classification for Nursing Practice, a standardized terminology for nursing.

Data & Technical Standards.label: IDMP
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Identification of Medicinal Products, a set of five ISO standards developed in response to a worldwide demand for internationally harmonized specifications for medicinal products.

Data & Technical Standards.label: IEEE 11073 SDC
Data & Technical Standards.definition: An IEEE standard for Service-oriented Device Connectivity, designed for interoperable and secure communication for medical devices.

Data & Technical Standards.label: QRDA I
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Quality Reporting Document Architecture Category I, a standard for reporting individual patient-level quality data.

Data & Technical Standards.label: TCP/IP
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol, the foundational protocol suite of the internet.

Data & Technical Standards.label: THOR
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Transferrable Holistic Oral Record, an ANSI/DSI standard for patient-controlled dental data interoperability.

Data & Technical Standards.label: UMLS
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Unified Medical Language System, a set of files and software from the National Library of Medicine that brings together many health and biomedical vocabularies.

Data & Technical Standards.label: DS4P
Data & Technical Standards.definition: Data Segmentation for Privacy, an HL7 standard for protecting sensitive information in electronic health records.

Data & Technical Standards.label: International Patient Summary
Data & Technical Standards.definition: A standardized set of basic patient health data for use in unscheduled, cross-border care scenarios.

Data & Technical Standards.label: JSON
Data & Technical Standards.definition: JavaScript Object Notation, a lightweight data-interchange format.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Electronic Health Record
Data Types & Health Information.definition: A digital version of a patient's paper chart.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Biometric Data
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Body measurements and calculations related to human characteristics.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Digital Identity
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Information on an entity used by computer systems to represent an external agent.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Claims Data
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Information submitted by a provider to a health insurance company to get paid for services.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Real-World Data
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Data relating to patient health status and/or the delivery of health care routinely collected from a variety of sources.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Electronic Health Information
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Individually identifiable health information that is transmitted by or maintained in electronic media.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Unstructured Data
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Information that either does not have a pre-defined data model or is not organized in a pre-defined manner.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Clinical Notes
Data Types & Health Information.definition: The written or dictated observations made by a healthcare professional about a patient's health status, treatments, and care plan.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Personal Health Record
Data Types & Health Information.definition: An electronic application through which patients can maintain and manage their health information in a private, secure, and confidential environment.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Protected Health Information
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Any information in a medical record that can be used to identify an individual, and that was created, used, or disclosed in the course of providing a health care service.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Radiology Images
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Medical images obtained through various technologies such as X-ray, MRI, CT scan.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Wearable Data
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Data collected from wearable electronic devices that can be worn as accessories, embedded in clothing, implanted in the user's body, or even tattooed on the skin.

Data Types & Health Information.label: Patient-Generated Health Data
Data Types & Health Information.definition: Health-related data created, recorded, or gathered by or from patients (or family members or other caregivers) to help address a health concern.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: CMS
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, the federal agency that administers Medicare and other health programs.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: ONC
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Office of the National Coordinator for Health Information Technology, a staff division of HHS.
terms: Office of the National Coordinator for Health Information Technology (ONC)

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: HHS
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.
terms: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: ASTP
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Assistant Secretary for Technology Policy, an office within HHS.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: FDA
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration, a federal agency responsible for protecting public health.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: NIST
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The National Institute of Standards and Technology, a physical sciences laboratory and non-regulatory agency of the U.S. Department of Commerce.
terms: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: VA
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, which provides healthcare services to eligible military veterans.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: CDC
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, a national public health agency.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: CMMI
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation, a division of CMS that tests new payment and service delivery models.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: OIG
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Office of Inspector General for the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: AHRQ
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality, a federal agency focused on health services research.
terms: Agency for Healthcare Quality and Research (AHRQ)

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: Social Security
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The U.S. Social Security Administration (SSA), an independent agency of the U.S. federal government that administers Social Security.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: MACs
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: Medicare Administrative Contractors, private health care insurers that have been awarded a geographic jurisdiction to process Medicare Part A and Part B medical claims.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: NIH
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The National Institutes of Health, the primary agency of the U.S. government responsible for biomedical and public health research.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: DOD
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The U.S. Department of Defense.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: FTC
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Federal Trade Commission, a U.S. federal agency that enforces antitrust law and promotes consumer protection.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: NLM
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The National Library of Medicine, a division of the NIH.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: HRSA
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Health Resources and Services Administration, an agency of HHS for improving health care to people who are geographically isolated, economically or medically vulnerable.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: IHS
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Indian Health Service, an operating division within HHS.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: Department of Labor
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: A U.S. federal executive department responsible for occupational safety, wage and hour standards, unemployment insurance benefits, and more.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: FEMA
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Federal Emergency Management Agency.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: OPM
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The U.S. Office of Personnel Management.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: SAMHSA
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, an agency within HHS.

Federal Agencies & Bodies.label: NCHS
Federal Agencies & Bodies.definition: The National Center for Health Statistics.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Medicare
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: The federal health insurance program for people who are 65 or older, certain younger people with disabilities, and people with End-Stage Renal Disease.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Medicaid
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A joint federal and state program that helps with medical costs for some people with limited income and resources.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Blue Button 2.0
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A CMS API that enables Medicare beneficiaries to connect their claims data to third-party applications and services.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Medicare Advantage
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A type of Medicare health plan offered by a private company that contracts with Medicare to provide Part A and B benefits.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Alternative Payment Models
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: Payment approaches that reward providers for delivering high-quality and cost-efficient care.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: MIPS
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: The Merit-based Incentive Payment System, a program that determines Medicare payment adjustments.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Medicare Shared Savings Program
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A CMS program that facilitates coordination and cooperation among providers to improve the quality of care for Medicare Fee-for-Service beneficiaries and reduce unnecessary costs.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Fee-for-Service
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A payment model where services are unbundled and paid for separately.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: ACO REACH
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: An alternative payment model that promotes health equity and high-quality, coordinated care in traditional Medicare.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Medicare Part D
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: Medicare coverage for prescription drugs.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Star Ratings
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A rating system used by CMS to measure the quality of Medicare Advantage and Part D plans.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: CHIP
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: The Children's Health Insurance Program, which provides low-cost health coverage to children in families who earn too much money to qualify for Medicaid.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Medicare Part A
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: Medicare coverage for hospital insurance.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Health IT Extension Program
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A proposed national program to provide local assistance to medical practices and patients in adopting new healthcare technologies.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Meaningful Use
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A former CMS program, now Promoting Interoperability, that provided incentives for using certified EHR technology.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Medicare Part B
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: Medicare coverage for medical insurance.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Medigap
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: Medicare Supplement Insurance sold by private companies to help pay some of the health care costs that Original Medicare doesn't cover.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: NCDs
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: National Coverage Determinations, which describe whether Medicare pays for specific medical items, services, or procedures.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Promoting Interoperability
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A CMS program that encourages eligible hospitals and critical access hospitals to continue to adopt, implement, upgrade, and demonstrate meaningful use of certified electronic health record technology (CEHRT).

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Acute Hospital Care at Home Program
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A CMS program that provides hospitals with flexibility to care for patients in their homes.
terms: Acute Hospital Care at Home Program

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: D-SNP
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: Dual Eligible Special Needs Plans, a type of Medicare Advantage plan for people who have both Medicare and Medicaid.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Home Health Value Based Purchasing Program
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A CMS model designed to incentivize better quality of care with greater efficiency among home health agencies.
terms: Home Health Value Based Purchasing (HHVBP) Program

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Hospital IQR Program
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: The Hospital Inpatient Quality Reporting Program, a pay-for-reporting quality program.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: MyMedicare
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A free, secure online service for managing personal information in Original Medicare.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Operation Warp Speed
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A public-private partnership initiated by the U.S. government to facilitate and accelerate the development, manufacturing, and distribution of COVID-19 vaccines, therapeutics, and diagnostics.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Patients Over Paperwork
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A CMS initiative to reduce administrative and regulatory burden.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: RADV Audits
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: Risk Adjustment Data Validation audits, which CMS uses to verify the accuracy of diagnosis data submitted by Medicare Advantage organizations.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: TEAM Model
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: Transforming Episode Accountability Model, a CMS bundled payment model for certain surgical procedures.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Annual Wellness Visit
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A yearly appointment with a primary care provider to create or update a personalized prevention plan.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Electronic Submission of Medical Data
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A CMS program for electronically submitting medical documentation.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Initial Preventive Physical Examination
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A one-time "Welcome to Medicare" preventive visit.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Make America Healthy Again
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A public health initiative.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Medicare Diabetes Prevention Program
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A health behavior change program for people with prediabetes to prevent or delay the onset of type 2 diabetes.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: National Directory of Healthcare Providers and Services
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A proposed centralized directory of healthcare providers and services.
terms: National Directory of Healthcare Providers and Services (NDH)

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Special Election Periods
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: Periods outside of the normal enrollment periods when an individual can sign up for a Medicare plan.

Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.label: Transitional Coverage of Emerging Technologies
Government Programs, Policies & Initiati.definition: A Medicare program to facilitate beneficiary access to new medical technologies.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Artificial Intelligence
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The theory and development of computer systems able to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Interoperability
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The ability of different information systems, devices and applications to access, exchange, integrate and cooperatively use data in a coordinated manner.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Digital Health
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The use of information and communications technologies in medicine and other health professions to manage illnesses and health risks and to promote wellness.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Value-Based Care
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A healthcare delivery model in which providers are paid based on patient health outcomes.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Care Coordination
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The deliberate organization of patient care activities between two or more participants involved in a patient's care to facilitate the appropriate delivery of health care services.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Informed Consent
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A process for getting permission before conducting a healthcare intervention on a person, or for disclosing personal information.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Telehealth
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The use of digital information and communication technologies, such as computers and mobile devices, to access health care services remotely and manage your health care.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Accountable Care Organizations
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: Groups of doctors, hospitals, and other health care providers, who come together voluntarily to give coordinated high-quality care to their Medicare patients.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Social Determinants of Health
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The conditions in the environments where people are born, live, learn, work, play, worship, and age that affect a wide range of health, functioning, and quality-of-life outcomes and risks.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Clinical Decision Support
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A health information technology system that is designed to provide physicians and other health professionals with clinical decision support, that is, assistance with clinical decision-making tasks.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Prior Authorization
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A decision by your health insurer or plan that a health care service, treatment plan, prescription drug or durable medical equipment is medically necessary.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Remote Patient Monitoring
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A method of healthcare delivery that uses the latest advances in information technology to gather patient data outside of traditional healthcare settings.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Health Equity
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The state in which everyone has a fair and just opportunity to attain their full health potential.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Preventive Care
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: Medical care that focuses on disease prevention, rather than disease treatment.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Risk Adjustment
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A statistical process that takes into account the underlying health status and health spending of the enrollees in an insurance plan when looking at their health care outcomes or costs.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Fraud, Waste, and Abuse
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: Intentional deception or misrepresentation that an individual knows to be false or does not believe to be true and makes, knowing that the deception could result in some unauthorized benefit.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Predictive Analytics
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The use of data, statistical algorithms and machine-learning techniques to identify the likelihood of future outcomes based on historical data.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Patient-Centered Care
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: Providing care that is respectful of and responsive to individual patient preferences, needs, and values, and ensuring that patient values guide all clinical decisions.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Digital Therapeutics
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A category of evidence-based therapeutic interventions that are driven by software to prevent, manage, or treat a medical disorder or disease.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Zero Trust
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A security model that requires all users, whether in or outside the organization’s network, to be authenticated, authorized, and continuously validated for security configuration and posture before being granted or keeping access to applications and data.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Health Literacy
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The degree to which individuals have the ability to find, understand, and use information and services to inform health-related decisions and actions for themselves and others.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Post-Acute Care
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: Care provided to patients who have been discharged from a hospital but still need medical care that cannot be provided at home.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Real-World Evidence
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: Health care information derived from multiple sources outside of typical clinical research settings, including electronic health records, claims and billing data, and data from product and disease registries.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Remote Therapeutic Monitoring
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A set of five CPT codes that reimburse for the monitoring of non-physiological data.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Blockchain
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A system of recording information in a way that makes it difficult or impossible to change, hack, or cheat the system.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Food-as-Medicine
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: An approach that uses food and nutrition to prevent, manage, and treat illness.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Biosurveillance
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The process of gathering, integrating, interpreting, and communicating essential information that might relate to disease activity and threats to human, animal, or plant health.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Hospital-at-Home
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A model of care that provides hospital-level care in a patient's home as a full substitute for acute hospital care.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Lifestyle Medicine
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A branch of medicine dealing with research, prevention and treatment of disorders caused by lifestyle factors such as nutrition, physical inactivity, and chronic stress.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Measurement-Based Care
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The practice of basing clinical care on patient data collected throughout treatment.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Medical Paternalism
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A concept in which a medical professional's power and authority is used to make decisions on behalf of a patient, with the belief that it is in their best interest, sometimes without the patient's full consent.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Pharmacogenomics
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: The study of how genes affect a person's response to drugs.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Chronic Care Management
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A specific CMS program providing care management services to Medicare beneficiaries with multiple chronic conditions.

Healthcare Concepts & Models.label: Electronic Visit Verification
Healthcare Concepts & Models.definition: A system used to verify that home healthcare services are actually delivered to people who are authorized to receive them.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Caregiver
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A family member or paid helper who regularly looks after a child or a sick, elderly, or disabled person.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Physician
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A person qualified to practice medicine.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Clinician
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A healthcare professional qualified in the clinical practice of medicine.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Nurse
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A healthcare professional who is trained to care for people who are ill or injured.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Radiologist
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A medical doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating diseases and injuries using medical imaging techniques.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Broker
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: An insurance professional who sells insurance policies from various companies to clients.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Pharmacist
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A person who is professionally qualified to prepare and dispense medicinal drugs.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Psychiatrist
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A medical practitioner specializing in the diagnosis and treatment of mental illness.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Diabetes Nurse Educator
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A nurse who specializes in the care and management of people with diabetes.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Dietitian
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: An expert on diet and nutrition.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Endocrinologist
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A medical doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating health conditions related to hormones.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Psychologist
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: An expert or specialist in psychology.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Surgeon
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A medical practitioner qualified to practice surgery.

Healthcare Professionals & Roles.label: Physician Associate
Healthcare Professionals & Roles.definition: A healthcare professional who practices medicine as a part of a healthcare team with collaborating physicians and other providers.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Health Information Exchanges
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: Organizations that provide services to enable the electronic sharing of health-related information among organizations.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Qualified Health Information Networks
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: Networks that are part of TEFCA and are responsible for routing queries, responses, and messages between participants.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Home Health Agency
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: An agency or organization that provides skilled nursing services and at least one other therapeutic service in the home.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Federally Qualified Health Centers
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: Community-based health care providers that receive funds from the HRSA Health Center Program to provide primary care services in underserved areas.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Hospice
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: A type of health care that focuses on the palliation of a chronically ill, terminally ill, or seriously ill patient's pain and symptoms, and attending to their emotional and spiritual needs at the end of life.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Pharmacy Benefit Managers
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: Companies that manage prescription drug benefits on behalf of health insurers, Medicare Part D drug plans, large employers, and other payers.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Community Health Centers
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: Community-based and patient-directed organizations that deliver comprehensive, culturally competent, high-quality primary health care services.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Skilled Nursing Facility
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: A facility that provides skilled nursing care and rehabilitation services.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Assisted Living Facility
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: A housing facility for people with disabilities or for adults who cannot or who choose not to live independently.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Dementia Care Unit
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: A specialized unit in a long-term care facility for people with Alzheimer's disease or other forms of dementia.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Area Agencies on Aging
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: Public or private non-profit agencies designated by the state to address the needs and concerns of all older persons at the regional and local levels.

Healthcare Settings & Organizations.label: Critical Access Hospital
Healthcare Settings & Organizations.definition: A designation given to eligible rural hospitals by CMS.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: Right to be Forgotten
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: A concept that individuals have the civil right to have private information about them removed from Internet searches and other directories under some circumstances.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: HIPAA
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996, a federal law that required the creation of national standards to protect sensitive patient health information.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: Information Blocking
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: A practice that is likely to interfere with, prevent, or materially discourage access, exchange, or use of electronic health information.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: 21st Century Cures Act
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: A 2016 law designed to help accelerate medical product development and bring new innovations and advances to patients who need them faster and more efficiently.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: Affordable Care Act
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: A comprehensive health care reform law enacted in March 2010.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: 42 CFR Part 2
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: A federal law that protects the confidentiality of substance use disorder patient records.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: FMLA
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: The Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993, a U.S. labor law requiring covered employers to provide employees with job-protected, unpaid leave for qualified medical and family reasons.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: HITECH Act
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: The Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act of 2009, which promoted the adoption and meaningful use of health information technology.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: REAL ID Act
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: A U.S. federal law that modifies federal law pertaining to security, authentication, and issuance procedure standards for drivers' licenses and identity documents.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: Health ACCESS Act
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: A bipartisan bill aimed at modernizing the Anti-Kickback Statute to support value-based care.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: Privacy Act of 1974
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: A federal law that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of personally identifiable information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: SUPPORT Act
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: The Substance Use-Disorder Prevention that Promotes Opioid Recovery and Treatment (SUPPORT) for Patients and Communities Act of 2018.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: Anti-Kickback Statute
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: A federal statute that prohibits the exchange of anything of value for referrals of Federal health care program business.

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: MACRA
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: The Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act of 2015, a bipartisan legislation that changed how Medicare rewards clinicians for value over volume.
terms: Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act of 2015 (MACRA)

Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.label: PAVE Act
Legislation, Regulations & Legal Concept.definition: The Penicillin Allergy Verification and Evaluation Act, proposed legislation to make penicillin allergy assessment a covered preventive service.
terms: Penicillin Allergy Verification and Evaluation (PAVE) Act (H.R. 9778)

Organizations & Associations.label: SNOMED International
Organizations & Associations.definition: A not-for-profit organization that owns and maintains SNOMED CT.

Organizations & Associations.label: Sequoia Project
Organizations & Associations.definition: A non-profit, 501(c)(3) public-private collaborative chartered to advance implementation of secure, interoperable nationwide health information exchange.

Organizations & Associations.label: CSIRO
Organizations & Associations.definition: The Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation, Australia's national science agency.

Organizations & Associations.label: Canada Health Infoway
Organizations & Associations.definition: A federally funded, independent, not-for-profit organization tasked with accelerating the development and adoption of digital health in Canada.

Organizations & Associations.label: Nictiz
Organizations & Associations.definition: The Dutch national competence center for electronic exchange of health and care information.

Organizations & Associations.label: AARP
Organizations & Associations.definition: An American interest group focusing on issues affecting those over the age of fifty.

Organizations & Associations.label: Da Vinci Project
Organizations & Associations.definition: A private-sector initiative to help payers and providers positively impact clinical, quality, cost and care management outcomes.

Organizations & Associations.label: TEACHERS FOR CHOICE
Organizations & Associations.definition: An advocacy group representing educators that opposes medical mandates.

Organizations & Associations.label: Accelerating Care Transformation Initiative
Organizations & Associations.definition: A multi-stakeholder association focused on reengineering clinical workflows.

Organizations & Associations.label: Citizens Commission on Human Rights
Organizations & Associations.definition: An international mental health watchdog group established by the Church of Scientology.
terms: Citizens Commission on Human Rights - CCHR

Organizations & Associations.label: Community Catalyst
Organizations & Associations.definition: A national non-profit consumer health advocacy group.

Organizations & Associations.label: Council on Foreign Relations
Organizations & Associations.definition: An American nonprofit, nonpartisan think tank and membership organization that focuses on U.S. foreign policy and international affairs.

Organizations & Associations.label: Health first physicians ACO
Organizations & Associations.definition: An Accountable Care Organization.

Organizations & Associations.label: Leavitt Partners
Organizations & Associations.definition: A health care intelligence business.

Organizations & Associations.label: No Delays, No Surprises Coalition
Organizations & Associations.definition: A health care industry coalition advocating for shared digital infrastructure.

Organizations & Associations.label: Peterson Health Technology Institute
Organizations & Associations.definition: An organization that conducts independent evaluations of digital health technologies.

Organizations & Associations.label: Policy Center for Maternal Mental Health
Organizations & Associations.definition: A non-profit policy and research think tank.
terms: Policy Center for Maternal Mental Health

Organizations & Associations.label: SAFI Clinical Informatics Group LLC
Organizations & Associations.definition: A clinical informatics training organization.

Organizations & Associations.label: South Carolina Primary Health Care Association
Organizations & Associations.definition: A health care association representing Community Health Centers in South Carolina.
terms: South Carolina Primary Health Care Association

Organizations & Associations.label: The CARIN Alliance
Organizations & Associations.definition: A non-partisan, multi-sector alliance working to enable consumers to get, use, and share their digital health information.

Organizations & Associations.label: WEDI
Organizations & Associations.definition: The Workgroup for Electronic Data Interchange, a formal advisory committee to the Secretary of Health and Human Services.

Organizations & Associations.label: Agilian Government Solutions
Organizations & Associations.definition: A government technology solutions provider.

Organizations & Associations.label: American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology
Organizations & Associations.definition: A professional medical association for specialists in allergy, asthma, and immunology.
terms: American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology (AAAAI)

Organizations & Associations.label: American Academy of Neurology
Organizations & Associations.definition: A professional society representing more than 40,000 neurologists and neuroscience professionals.

Organizations & Associations.label: American Academy of Physician Associates
Organizations & Associations.definition: The national professional society for physician associates (PAs).

Organizations & Associations.label: American College of Cardiology
Organizations & Associations.definition: A professional medical society and teaching institution for cardiovascular professionals.

Organizations & Associations.label: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists
Organizations & Associations.definition: A professional association of physicians specializing in obstetrics and gynecology in the United States.
terms: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG)

Organizations & Associations.label: American Diabetes Association
Organizations & Associations.definition: A United States-based nonprofit that seeks to educate the public about diabetes and to help those affected by it.

Organizations & Associations.label: Bipartisan Policy Center
Organizations & Associations.definition: A non-profit organization that promotes bipartisanship.

Organizations & Associations.label: Dental Standards Institute
Organizations & Associations.definition: An ANSI-accredited standards development organization for the dental sector.

Organizations & Associations.label: Federation of State Medical Boards
Organizations & Associations.definition: A national non-profit organization representing the 69 state medical and osteopathic boards of the U.S. and its territories.

Organizations & Associations.label: Health and Reentry Project
Organizations & Associations.definition: An advocacy group focused on improving health care access for individuals impacted by the justice system.

Organizations & Associations.label: Medical Alert Monitoring Association
Organizations & Associations.definition: An industry association representing the personal emergency response services (PERS) industry.

Organizations & Associations.label: Partnership to Advance Virtual Care
Organizations & Associations.definition: An advocacy coalition representing health systems, health IT vendors, and other stakeholders.

Organizations & Associations.label: Society of Thoracic Surgeons
Organizations & Associations.definition: A global organization representing cardiothoracic surgeons.

Organizations & Associations.label: Texas Medical Association
Organizations & Associations.definition: A professional association representing physicians in Texas.

Organizations & Associations.label: World Health Organization
Organizations & Associations.definition: A specialized agency of the United Nations responsible for international public health.

Organizations & Associations.label: cnmi growers association
Organizations & Associations.definition: An advocacy group from the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.
terms: cnmi growers association / panopticon group ww (CNMIGA.ORG)

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Application
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A software program that runs on a computer or mobile device.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Wearables
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A category of electronic devices that can be worn as accessories, embedded in clothing, implanted in the user's body, or even tattooed on the skin.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Patient Portal
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A secure online website that gives patients convenient, 24-hour access to personal health information from anywhere with an Internet connection.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Smartphone
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A mobile phone that performs many of the functions of a computer, typically having a touchscreen interface, internet access, and an operating system capable of running downloaded apps.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Algorithm
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A process or set of rules to be followed in calculations or other problem-solving operations, especially by a computer.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Cloud
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A network of servers and the software and databases that run on those servers, which provide various services over the Internet.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Mobile App
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A software application developed specifically for use on small, wireless computing devices, such as smartphones and tablets, rather than desktop or laptop computers.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Sandbox
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A testing environment that isolates untested code changes and outright experimentation from the production environment or repository.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Natural Language Processing
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A subfield of linguistics, computer science, and artificial intelligence concerned with the interactions between computers and human language.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Large Language Models
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A type of AI algorithm that uses deep learning techniques and massively large data sets to understand, summarize, generate, and predict new content.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Chatbot
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A computer program designed to simulate conversation with human users, especially over the Internet.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Machine Learning
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A branch of artificial intelligence and computer science which focuses on the use of data and algorithms to imitate the way that humans learn, gradually improving its accuracy.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Software as a Service
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A software licensing and delivery model in which software is licensed on a subscription basis and is centrally hosted.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Avatar
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A graphical representation of a user or the user's character or persona.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Ontology
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A formal naming and definition of the types, properties, and interrelationships of the entities that really or fundamentally exist for a particular domain of discourse.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: AI Agent
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: An autonomous program that perceives its environment and takes actions to achieve goals.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: AI Model
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A program or algorithm that uses a set of data to recognize certain types of patterns.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: AI Gateway
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A central point of control for managing and securing API traffic, including AI-driven services.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Bulk Data Export
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: The process of exporting large datasets from a system, often for analytics or data migration.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Federated Learning
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A machine learning technique that trains an algorithm across multiple decentralized edge devices or servers holding local data samples, without exchanging them.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Smart Contracts
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: Self-executing contracts with the terms of the agreement between buyer and seller being directly written into lines of code.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Data Mesh
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A decentralized sociotechnical approach to share, access, and manage analytical data in complex and large-scale environments.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Digital Wallet
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: An electronic device, online service, or software program that allows one party to make electronic transactions with another party.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: EHR Inbox
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: The electronic messaging system within an Electronic Health Record.

Technological Concepts & Components.label: Virtual Card
Technological Concepts & Components.definition: A digital credit or debit card that is created for online transactions.
